title: Loch Ordie Walking Route

images.title: Afternoon sun on Loch Ordie by Lis Burke, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Afternoon sun on the loch.

images.title: James Allan / Eastern end of Loch Ordie
images.caption: Eastern end of Loch Ordie. Viewed from the track leading towards Riemore Lodge

images.title: Russel Wills / Dowally Burn flows out of Loch Ordie
images.caption: Dowally Burn flows out of the loch. This is fine walking and mountain bike country. Fishermen like it too.

images.title: Ian Cleland / Fishing Boats on Loch Ordie
images.caption: Fishing Boats on Loch Ordie

images.title: James Allan / Curve in the track
images.caption: Curve in the track. Walkers making their way round a curve in the footpath towards the summit of Deuchary Hill with Loch Ordie visible in the background.

images.title: Dorothy Carse / Rough Ground, Loch Ordie
images.caption: Rough Ground. Mossy grassland with scattered bracken on the eastern side of the loch.

description: This walk follows trails around the beautiful Loch Ordie in the Forest of Clunie, Dunkeld. You can follow a circular trail around the tranquil loch with fine views to the surrounding woodland and forestry. You can reach the loch by following footpaths from Guay, Dowally or Kindallachan which sit next to the River Tay about 3 miles west of the loch.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head east from the loch and you can climb to Riemore Hill and visit Loch Benachally. Head south into Dunkeld and you can try the delightful Hermitage Woodland Walk. The climb to Birnam Hill can also be found just south of Dunkeld. There are some excellent views from this fine vantage point. Heading east along the river from the town will take you to the famous Birnam Oak, an ancient tree mentioned in Shakespeare’s Macbeth. You can enjoy more waterside walking around the Loch of the Lowes and Loch Clunie. There's also Tay Forest Park with miles of good walking and cycling trails to try.

display_address: Landrover Experience Rocky Road, Perth and Kinross, Alba / Scotland, PH8 0ER, United Kingdom
